intro: Conyza cafra, commonly known as African ironweed, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is an annual herb that typically grows up to 1.5 meters tall, with hairy stems and alternate leaves. The plant produces small, yellow composite flowers that are arranged in clusters, attracting various pollinators. Its seeds are dispersed by wind, contributing to its wide distribution across arid and semi-arid regions. Conyza cafra is also known for its medicinal properties, with traditional uses in treating ailments such as inflammation and respiratory issues.
